00064 /** Given an LLVM type, try to find the equivalent ispc type.  Note that
00065     this is an under-constrained problem due to LLVM's type representations
00066     carrying less information than ispc's.  (For example, LLVM doesn't
00067     distinguish between signed and unsigned integers in its types.)  
00068 
00069     However, because this function is only used for generating ispc
00070     declarations of functions defined in LLVM bitcode in the stdlib-*.ll
00071     files, in practice we can get enough of what we need for the relevant
00072     cases to make things work.
00073  */
00074 static const Type *
00075 lLLVMTypeToISPCType(const llvm::Type *t) {
00076     if (t == LLVMTypes::VoidType)
00077         return AtomicType::Void;
00078     else if (t == LLVMTypes::BoolType)
00079         return AtomicType::UniformBool;
00080     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int32Type)
00081         return AtomicType::UniformInt32;
00082     else if (t == LLVMTypes::FloatType)
00083         return AtomicType::UniformFloat;
00084     else if (t == LLVMTypes::DoubleType)
00085         return AtomicType::UniformDouble;
00086     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int64Type)
00087         return AtomicType::UniformInt64;
00088     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
00089         return AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
00090     else if (t == LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType)
00091         return AtomicType::VaryingFloat;
00092     else if (t == LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType)
00093         return AtomicType::VaryingDouble;
00094     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType)
00095         return AtomicType::VaryingInt64;
00096     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int32PointerType)
00097         return new ReferenceType(AtomicType::UniformInt32, false);
00098     else if (t == LLVMTypes::FloatPointerType)
00099         return new ReferenceType(AtomicType::UniformFloat, false);
00100     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorPointerType)
00101         return new ReferenceType(AtomicType::VaryingInt32, false);
00102     else if (t == LLVMTypes::FloatVectorPointerType)
00103         return new ReferenceType(AtomicType::VaryingFloat, false);
00104     else if (llvm::isa<const llvm::PointerType>(t)) {
00105         const llvm::PointerType *pt = llvm::dyn_cast<const llvm::PointerType>(t);
00106 
00107         // Is it a pointer to an unsized array of objects?  If so, then
00108         // create the equivalent ispc type.  Note that it has to be a
00109         // reference to an array, since ispc passes arrays to functions by
00110         // reference.
00111         //
00112         // FIXME: generalize this to do more than uniform int32s (that's
00113         // all that's necessary for the stdlib currently.)
00114         const llvm::ArrayType *at = 
00115             llvm::dyn_cast<const llvm::ArrayType>(pt->getElementType());
00116         if (at && at->getNumElements() == 0 &&
00117             at->getElementType() == LLVMTypes::Int32Type)
00118             return new ReferenceType(new ArrayType(AtomicType::UniformInt32, 0),
00119                                      false);
00120     }
00121 
00122     return NULL;
00123 }
00124 
00125 
00126 /** Given an LLVM function declaration, synthesize the equivalent ispc
00127     symbol for the function (if possible).  Returns true on success, false
00128     on failure.
00129  */
00130 static bool
00131 lCreateISPCSymbol(llvm::Function *func, SymbolTable *symbolTable) {
00132     SourcePos noPos;
00133     noPos.name = "__stdlib";
00134 
00135     const llvm::FunctionType *ftype = func->getFunctionType();
00136     std::string name = func->getName();
00137 
00138     const Type *returnType = lLLVMTypeToISPCType(ftype->getReturnType());
00139     if (!returnType)
00140         // return type not representable in ispc -> not callable from ispc
00141         return false;
00142 
00143     // Iterate over the arguments and try to find their equivalent ispc
00144     // types.
00145     std::vector<const Type *> argTypes;
00146     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < ftype->getNumParams(); ++i) {
00147         const llvm::Type *llvmArgType = ftype->getParamType(i);
00148         const Type *type = lLLVMTypeToISPCType(llvmArgType);
00149         if (type == NULL)
00150             return false;
00151         argTypes.push_back(type);
00152     }
00153 
00154     FunctionType *funcType = new FunctionType(returnType, argTypes, noPos);
00155     Symbol *sym = new Symbol(name, noPos, funcType);
00156     sym->function = func;
00157     symbolTable->AddFunction(sym);
00158     return true;
00159 }

00162 /** Given an LLVM module, create ispc symbols for the functions in the
00163     module.
00164  */
00165 static void
00166 lAddModuleSymbols(llvm::Module *module, SymbolTable *symbolTable) {
00167 #if 0
00168     // FIXME: handle globals?
00169     assert(module->global_empty());
00170 #endif
00171 
00172     llvm::Module::iterator iter;
00173     for (iter = module->begin(); iter != module->end(); ++iter) {
00174         llvm::Function *func = iter;
00175         lCreateISPCSymbol(func, symbolTable);
00176     }
00177 }

00179 /** Declare the function symbol 'bool __is_compile_time_constant_mask(mask type)'.  
00180     This function will never be defined; it's just a placeholder
00181     that will be handled during the optimization process.  See the
00182     discussion of the implementation of CompileTimeConstantResolvePass for
00183     more details.
00184  */
00185 static void
00186 lDeclareCompileTimeConstant(llvm::Module *module) {
00187     SourcePos noPos;
00188     noPos.name = "__stdlib";
00189 
00190     std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00191     argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::MaskType);
00192 
00193     llvm::FunctionType *fType = 
00194         llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::BoolType, argTypes, false);
00195     llvm::Function *func =
00196         llvm::Function::Create(fType, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00197                                "__is_compile_time_constant_mask", module);
00198     func->setOnlyReadsMemory(true);
00199     func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00200 }

00202 
00203 /** Declare the 'pseudo-gather' functions.  When the ispc front-end needs
00204     to perform a gather, it generates a call to one of these functions,
00205     which have signatures:
00206     
00207     varying int32 __pseudo_gather(varying int32 *, mask)
00208     varying int64 __pseudo_gather(varying int64 *, mask)
00209 
00210     These functions are never actually implemented; the
00211     GatherScatterFlattenOpt optimization pass finds them and then converts
00212     them to make calls to the following functions, which represent gathers
00213     from a common base pointer with offsets.  This approach allows the
00214     front-end to be relatively simple in how it emits address calculation
00215     for gathers.
00216 
00217     varying int32 __pseudo_gather_base_offsets_32(uniform int32 *base, 
00218                                                   int32 offsets, mask)
00219     varying int64 __pseudo_gather_base_offsets_64(uniform int64 *base, 
00220                                                   int64 offsets, mask)
00221 
00222     Then, the GSImprovementsPass optimizations finds these and either
00223     converts them to native gather functions or converts them to vector
00224     loads, if equivalent.
00225  */
00226 static void
00227 lDeclarePseudoGathers(llvm::Module *module) {
00228     SourcePos noPos;
00229     noPos.name = "__stdlib";
00230 
00231     {
00232         std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00233         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerVectorType);
00234         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::MaskType);
00235 
00236         llvm::FunctionType *fType = 
00237             llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType, argTypes, false);
00238         llvm::Function *func =
00239             llvm::Function::Create(fType, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00240                                    "__pseudo_gather_32", module);
00241         func->setOnlyReadsMemory(true);
00242         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00243 
00244         fType = llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType, argTypes, false);
00245         func = llvm::Function::Create(fType, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00246                                       "__pseudo_gather_64", module);
00247         func->setOnlyReadsMemory(true);
00248         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00249     }
00250 
00251     {
00252         std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00253         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
00254         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType);
00255         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::MaskType);
00256 
00257         llvm::FunctionType *fType = 
00258             llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType, argTypes, false);
00259         llvm::Function *func =
00260             llvm::Function::Create(fType, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00261                                    "__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_32", module);
00262         func->setOnlyReadsMemory(true);
00263         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00264 
00265         fType = llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType, argTypes, false);
00266         func = llvm::Function::Create(fType, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00267                                       "__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_64", module);
00268         func->setOnlyReadsMemory(true);
00269         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00270     }
00271 }
00272 
00273 
00274 /** Similarly to the 'pseudo-gathers' defined by lDeclarePseudoGathers(),
00275     we also declare (but never define) pseudo-scatter instructions with
00276     signatures:
00277 
00278     void __pseudo_scatter_32(varying int32 *, varying int32 values, mask)
00279     void __pseudo_scatter_64(varying int64 *, varying int64 values, mask)
00280 
00281     The GatherScatterFlattenOpt optimization pass also finds these and
00282     transforms them to scatters like:
00283 
00284     void __pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_32(uniform int32 *base, 
00285                     varying int32 offsets, varying int32 values, mask)
00286     void __pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_64(uniform int64 *base, 
00287                     varying int62 offsets, varying int64 values, mask)
00288 
00289     And the GSImprovementsPass in turn converts these to actual native
00290     scatters or masked stores.  
00291 */
00292 static void
00293 lDeclarePseudoScatters(llvm::Module *module) {
00294     SourcePos noPos;
00295     noPos.name = "__stdlib";
00296 
00297     {
00298         std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00299         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerVectorType);
00300         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType);
00301         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::MaskType);
00302 
00303         llvm::FunctionType *fType = 
00304             llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidType, argTypes, false);
00305         llvm::Function *func =
00306             llvm::Function::Create(fType, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00307                                    "__pseudo_scatter_32", module);
00308         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00309     }
00310     {
00311         std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00312         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerVectorType);
00313         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType);
00314         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::MaskType);
00315 
00316         llvm::FunctionType *fType = 
00317             llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidType, argTypes, false);
00318         llvm::Function *func =
00319             llvm::Function::Create(fType, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00320                                    "__pseudo_scatter_64", module);
00321         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00322     }
00323 
00324     {
00325         std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00326         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
00327         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType);
00328         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType);
00329         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::MaskType);
00330 
00331         llvm::FunctionType *fType = 
00332             llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidType, argTypes, false);
00333         llvm::Function *func =
00334             llvm::Function::Create(fType, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00335                                    "__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_32", module);
00336         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00337     }
00338     {
00339         std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00340         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
00341         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType);
00342         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType);
00343         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::MaskType);
00344 
00345         llvm::FunctionType *fType = 
00346             llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidType, argTypes, false);
00347         llvm::Function *func =
00348             llvm::Function::Create(fType, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00349                                    "__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_64", module);
00350         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00351     }
00352 }

00355 /** This function declares placeholder masked store functions for the
00356     front-end to use.
00357 
00358     void __pseudo_masked_store_32(uniform int32 *ptr, varying int32 values, mask)
00359     void __pseudo_masked_store_64(uniform int64 *ptr, varying int64 values, mask)
00360 
00361     These in turn are converted to native masked stores or to regular
00362     stores (if the mask is all on) by the MaskedStoreOptPass optimization
00363     pass.
00364  */
00365 static void
00366 lDeclarePseudoMaskedStore(llvm::Module *module) {
00367     SourcePos noPos;
00368     noPos.name = "__stdlib";
00369 
00370     {
00371     std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00372     argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorPointerType);
00373     argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType);
00374     argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::MaskType);
00375 
00376     llvm::FunctionType *fType = 
00377         llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidType, argTypes, false);
00378     llvm::Function *func = 
00379         llvm::Function::Create(fType, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00380                                "__pseudo_masked_store_32", module);
00381     func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00382     func->addFnAttr(llvm::Attribute::AlwaysInline);
00383     func->setDoesNotCapture(1, true);
00384     }
00385 
00386     {
00387     std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00388     argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int64VectorPointerType);
00389     argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType);
00390     argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::MaskType);
00391 
00392     llvm::FunctionType *fType = 
00393         llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidType, argTypes, false);
00394     llvm::Function *func = 
00395         llvm::Function::Create(fType, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00396                                "__pseudo_masked_store_64", module);
00397     func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00398     func->addFnAttr(llvm::Attribute::AlwaysInline);
00399     func->setDoesNotCapture(1, true);
00400     }
00401 }

00404 /** This utility function takes serialized binary LLVM bitcode and adds its
00405     definitions to the given module.  Functions in the bitcode that can be
00406     mapped to ispc functions are also added to the symbol table.
00407 
00408     @param bitcode     Binary LLVM bitcode (e.g. the contents of a *.bc file)
00409     @param length      Length of the bitcode buffer
00410     @param module      Module to link the bitcode into
00411     @param symbolTable Symbol table to add definitions to
00412  */
00413 static void
00414 lAddBitcode(const unsigned char *bitcode, int length,
00415             llvm::Module *module, SymbolTable *symbolTable) {
00416     std::string bcErr;
00417     llvm::StringRef sb = llvm::StringRef((char *)bitcode, length);
00418     llvm::MemoryBuffer *bcBuf = llvm::MemoryBuffer::getMemBuffer(sb);
00419     llvm::Module *bcModule = llvm::ParseBitcodeFile(bcBuf, *g->ctx, &bcErr);
00420     if (!bcModule)
00421         Error(SourcePos(), "Error parsing stdlib bitcode: %s", bcErr.c_str());
00422     else {
00423         std::string(linkError);
00424         if (llvm::Linker::LinkModules(module, bcModule, &linkError))
00425             Error(SourcePos(), "Error linking stdlib bitcode: %s", linkError.c_str());
00426         lAddModuleSymbols(module, symbolTable);
00427     }
00428 }

00431 /** Utility routine that defines a constant int32 with given value, adding
00432     the symbol to both the ispc symbol table and the given LLVM module.
00433  */
00434 static void
00435 lDefineConstantInt(const char *name, int val, llvm::Module *module,
00436                    SymbolTable *symbolTable) {
00437     Symbol *pw = new Symbol(name, SourcePos(), AtomicType::UniformConstInt32);
00438     pw->isStatic = true;
00439     pw->constValue = new ConstExpr(pw->type, val, SourcePos());
00440     const llvm::Type *ltype = LLVMTypes::Int32Type;
00441     llvm::Constant *linit = LLVMInt32(val);
00442     pw->storagePtr = new llvm::GlobalVariable(*module, ltype, true, 
00443                                               llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage,
00444                                               linit, pw->name.c_str());
00445     symbolTable->AddVariable(pw);
00446 }
00447 
00448 
00449 static void
00450 lDefineProgramIndex(llvm::Module *module, SymbolTable *symbolTable) {
00451     Symbol *pidx = new Symbol("programIndex", SourcePos(), 
00452                               AtomicType::VaryingConstInt32);
00453     pidx->isStatic = true;
00454 
00455     int pi[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00456     for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
00457         pi[i] = i;
00458     pidx->constValue = new ConstExpr(pidx->type, pi, SourcePos());
00459 
00460     const llvm::Type *ltype = LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
00461     llvm::Constant *linit = LLVMInt32Vector(pi);
00462     pidx->storagePtr = new llvm::GlobalVariable(*module, ltype, true, 
00463                                                 llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage, linit, 
00464                                                 pidx->name.c_str());
00465     symbolTable->AddVariable(pidx);
00466 }

00468 
00469 void
00470 DefineStdlib(SymbolTable *symbolTable, llvm::LLVMContext *ctx, llvm::Module *module,
00471              bool includeStdlibISPC) {
00472     // Add the definitions from the compiled stdlib-c.c file
00473     extern unsigned char stdlib_bitcode_c[];
00474     extern int stdlib_bitcode_c_length;
00475     lAddBitcode(stdlib_bitcode_c, stdlib_bitcode_c_length, module, symbolTable);
00476 
00477     // Next, add the target's custom implementations of the various needed
00478     // builtin functions (e.g. __masked_store_32(), etc).
00479     switch (g->target.isa) {
00480     case Target::SSE2:
00481         extern unsigned char stdlib_bitcode_sse2[];
00482         extern int stdlib_bitcode_sse2_length;
00483         lAddBitcode(stdlib_bitcode_sse2, stdlib_bitcode_sse2_length, module,
00484                     symbolTable);
00485         break;
00486     case Target::SSE4:
00487         extern unsigned char stdlib_bitcode_sse4[];
00488         extern int stdlib_bitcode_sse4_length;
00489         extern unsigned char stdlib_bitcode_sse4x2[];
00490         extern int stdlib_bitcode_sse4x2_length;
00491         switch (g->target.vectorWidth) {
00492         case 4: 
00493             lAddBitcode(stdlib_bitcode_sse4, stdlib_bitcode_sse4_length, 
00494                         module, symbolTable);
00495             break;
00496         case 8:
00497             lAddBitcode(stdlib_bitcode_sse4x2, stdlib_bitcode_sse4x2_length, 
00498                         module, symbolTable);
00499             break;
00500         default:
00501             FATAL("logic error in DefineStdlib");
00502         }
00503         break;
00504     case Target::AVX:
00505         extern unsigned char stdlib_bitcode_avx[];
00506         extern int stdlib_bitcode_avx_length;
00507         lAddBitcode(stdlib_bitcode_avx, stdlib_bitcode_avx_length, module, 
00508                     symbolTable);
00509         break;
00510     default:
00511         FATAL("logic error");
00512     }
00513 
00514     // Add a declaration of void *ISPCMalloc(int64_t).  The user is
00515     // responsible for linking in a definition of this if it's needed by
00516     // the compiled program.
00517     { std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00518         argTypes.push_back(llvm::Type::getInt64Ty(*ctx));
00519         llvm::FunctionType *ftype = llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, 
00520                                                             argTypes, false);
00521         llvm::Function *func = 
00522             llvm::Function::Create(ftype, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00523                                    "ISPCMalloc", module);
00524         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00525     }
00526 
00527     // Add a declaration of void ISPCFree(void *).  The user is
00528     // responsible for linking in a definition of this if it's needed by
00529     // the compiled program.
00530     { std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00531         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
00532         llvm::FunctionType *ftype = llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, 
00533                                                             argTypes, false);
00534         llvm::Function *func = 
00535             llvm::Function::Create(ftype, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00536                                    "ISPCFree", module);
00537         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00538     }
00539 
00540     // Add a declaration of void ISPCLaunch(void *funcPtr, void *data).
00541     // The user is responsible for linking in a definition of this if it's
00542     // needed by the compiled program.
00543     { std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00544         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
00545         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
00546         llvm::FunctionType *ftype = llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidType, 
00547                                                             argTypes, false);
00548         llvm::Function *func = 
00549             llvm::Function::Create(ftype, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00550                                    "ISPCLaunch", module);
00551         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00552     }
00553 
00554     // Add a declaration of void ISPCSync().  The user is responsible for
00555     // linking in a definition of this if it's needed by the compiled
00556     // program.
00557     { 
00558         std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00559         llvm::FunctionType *ftype = llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidType, 
00560                                                             argTypes, false);
00561         llvm::Function *func = 
00562             llvm::Function::Create(ftype, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00563                                    "ISPCSync", module);
00564         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00565     }
00566 
00567     // Add a declaration of void ISPCInstrument(void *, void *, int, int).
00568     // The user is responsible for linking in a definition of this if it's
00569     // needed by the compiled program.
00570     { 
00571         std::vector<const llvm::Type *> argTypes;
00572         argTypes.push_back(llvm::PointerType::get(llvm::Type::getInt8Ty(*g->ctx), 0));
00573         argTypes.push_back(llvm::PointerType::get(llvm::Type::getInt8Ty(*g->ctx), 0));
00574         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32Type);
00575         argTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32Type);
00576         llvm::FunctionType *ftype = llvm::FunctionType::get(LLVMTypes::VoidType, 
00577                                                             argTypes, false);
00578         llvm::Function *func = 
00579             llvm::Function::Create(ftype, llvm::GlobalValue::ExternalLinkage,
00580                                    "ISPCInstrument", module);
00581         func->setDoesNotThrow(true);
00582     }
00583 
00584     // Declare various placeholder functions that the optimizer will later
00585     // find and replace with something more useful.
00586     lDeclareCompileTimeConstant(module);
00587     lDeclarePseudoGathers(module);
00588     lDeclarePseudoScatters(module);
00589     lDeclarePseudoMaskedStore(module);
00590 
00591     // define the 'programCount' builtin variable
00592     lDefineConstantInt("programCount", g->target.vectorWidth, module, symbolTable);
00593 
00594     // define the 'programIndex' builtin
00595     lDefineProgramIndex(module, symbolTable);
00596 
00597     // Define __math_lib stuff.  This is used by stdlib.ispc, for example, to
00598     // figure out which math routines to end up calling...
00599     lDefineConstantInt("__math_lib", (int)g->mathLib, module, symbolTable);
00600     lDefineConstantInt("__math_lib_ispc", (int)Globals::Math_ISPC, module,
00601                        symbolTable);
00602     lDefineConstantInt("__math_lib_ispc_fast", (int)Globals::Math_ISPCFast, 
00603                        module, symbolTable);
00604     lDefineConstantInt("__math_lib_svml", (int)Globals::Math_SVML, module,
00605                        symbolTable);
00606     lDefineConstantInt("__math_lib_system", (int)Globals::Math_System, module,
00607                        symbolTable);
00608 
00609     if (includeStdlibISPC) {
00610         // If the user wants the standard library to be included, parse the
00611         // serialized version of the stdlib.ispc file to get its definitions
00612         // added.
00613         extern const char *stdlib_code;
00614         yy_scan_string(stdlib_code);
00615         yyparse();
00616     }
00617 }
